description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 1a). Written in black and red ink in a casual script bent to the right. The tables are drawn in red ink. Glazed European paper. The paper of the second part (from fol. 12 on) is smoother than that of the first part. Instructions by the copyist on how to read the tables on fol. 7a and 11a. Collation: Paper, fol. 30 ; 1⁸ (+4, ff. 1-2, 11-12) 2⁶ 3⁸ 4⁴. There is no colophon. Incipit: منكوس ستيني جدول الظل الاول [...] يسمي(؟) الظل المعكوس من زيج الغ بيك السمرقمدي بِحَذْف التفاصل وزيادة العدد المنا[--]س Explicit: ثم جمعنا الحاصلين فكان المبلغ [...] لط ح لطه فقِسْ علي ذلك تصِب ان شا الله تعالي
author: Ulugh Beg, 1394-1449
abstract: Part of the astronomical tables of Ulugh Bey in Arabic, comprising the table of the First Shadow (al-ẓill al-awwal) and the table of the Sine (al-jayb), with instructions on how to use the second one.
extent: 30 leaves : paper ; 225 x 165 (203 x 15) mm. bound to 225 x 176 mm.
title: Jadwal al-ẓill al-awwal al-mankūs al-sittīnī min Zīj Lughbīk.
provenance: Acquired from Brill, Leyden, 1904, from the books of Amīn ibn al-Ḥasan al-Ḥulwānī al-Madanī al-Ḥanafī (Medina).
creator: Ulugh Beg, 1394-1449
subject: Astronomy, Arab—Tables—15th century
binding_note: Upper and lower covers and envelope flap have paper with red motifs on a beige background pasted on leather over paper pasteboards. Paper pastedowns. Disbound.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
